New Records: Luiz Henrique scored the winning goal in the 89th minute to give Brazil a 2-1 away win over Chile in a 2026 World Cup qualifying match
Key Match Events: Chile opened the scoring seconds after the kickoff with a header by Eduardo Vargas
Brazil struggled to create clear chances, but managed to equalize in added time with a header by Igor Jesus
Luiz Henrique decided to take his chances from the edge of the box and scored the winning goal in the 89th minute
Pre-Game Insights: Dorival Júnior said that his team will continue to have ups and downs as the coach tries out new players
The win meant under-pressure Brazil coach Dorival Júnior’s team will finish the ninth round of the round-robin competition in fourth place in South American qualifying
Post-Match Reflections: Luiz Henrique said that the shirt means a lot and it is a great feeling for them to wear it
Dorival Júnior said that his team will have a very strong team two years from now
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was delayed for 30 minutes due to a wet pitch at Monumental Stadium in the Venezuelan city of Maturin
Bolivia moved into fifth place with 12 points after its first win in 21 years against the Colombians
